programmes.show_description: Cerys Matthews presents an exploration of the impact of the hauntingly beautiful Welsh song of unrequited love. From April 2014.
4 Extra Debut. The post-diary story of Samuel Pepys via the music he commissioned. Some is played for the first time in 300 years. From 2017.
5/6. Just bad luck? Or is something more sinister behind jockey Rob Finn's poor form and loss of nerve? Stars Michael Kitchen.
An unusual request for a birthday present causes Derek to question his love for Adrienne. Stars Glyn Houston and Wendy Gifford.
4/6. Mammy joins Isobel in her office as a temporary cleaner - much to her daughter's dismay. Stars Eileen McCallum. From 1995.
1/8. Card sharks fleece Harold, so Albert steps in. Adapted from TV, with Wilfrid Brambell and Harry H Corbett. From January 1972.
3/4. Romcom inspired by Katherine Whitehorn's cookery classic. Trisha surprises Deepak on an outing. Stars Beattie Edmondson.
5/10. Betty gets work as a photographic tinter, a fur coat model-cum-book-keeper and secretary to a mobster. Read by Debora Weston.
5/5. Vera joins Irene's son to undertake a life-threatening undercover operation for MI6. Stars Patricia Routledge and Prunella Scales.
4/6. The panel game about the online reviews we post - wonderful, terrible or downright baffling. Hosted by Frank Skinner. From 2024.
3/4. When dealing with his wife's lover, QC Robert employs his deadliest weapon: being a gentleman. Stars Hugh Bonneville. From 2012.
3/3. Hugh Conway's old acquaintances try to discover if there's any truth behind his Shangri-La adventure. Stars Derek Jacobi.
4 Extra Debut. A wealthy Englishman heads to the continent to assassinate the head of a brutal European dictatorship. Stars Simon Cadell.
With a passion for food, Professor Ha-Joon Chang is "a hungry economist" who explains the world. Read by Arthur Lee.
